name: Microsoft Copilot Enterprise

HIPAA.details: Microsoft 365 Copilot Enterprise is covered under Microsoft's Business Associate Agreement (BAA) as of early 2024. HIPAA compliance applies to properly configured implementations but excludes web search queries.
HIPAA.limitations: Web search queries not covered by BAA | Requires proper configuration

GDPR.details: Full GDPR compliance with Data Protection Addendum (DPA) coverage, EU Data Boundary support, and ISO/IEC 27018 certification.
GDPR.evidence: DPA available | Privacy policy compliant | Third-party audit
GDPR.limitations: EU Data Boundary doesn't apply to web search queries

SOC_2.details: Microsoft Security Copilot achieved SOC 2 Type II certification in November 2024. Microsoft 365 platform maintains SOC 2 Type II compliance.
SOC_2.evidence: Public report | Third-party verification | Customer portal

ISO_27001.details: Microsoft Copilot for Security attained ISO 27001, 27017, and 27018 certifications in June 2024. Microsoft 365 platform maintains ISO 27001 certification.

PCI_DSS.details: Microsoft Copilot Enterprise does not process payment card data directly.

CCPA.details: Microsoft's privacy policy and DPA provide CCPA compliance through comprehensive data subject rights and privacy controls.
CCPA.evidence: Privacy policy | DPA addendum | Legal review

FedRAMP.details: Microsoft 365 Government Cloud has FedRAMP authorization. Standard commercial Copilot Enterprise working toward FedRAMP compliance.
FedRAMP.evidence: Documentation review | Government cloud ATO available
FedRAMP.limitations: Government cloud only for current authorization

summary_and_recommendation: Microsoft Copilot Enterprise demonstrates strong security posture with comprehensive compliance certifications, enterprise-grade data protection, and contractual guarantees against training use. The tool scored 18/100 (LOW RISK) due to excellent data handling practices, enterprise controls, and vendor transparency. Recommended for general enterprise use with standard monitoring. Note: Web search functionality operates under different data handling practices than core Copilot features.
primary_use_case: Enterprise productivity enhancement, document creation, data analysis, and business intelligence
data_classification: Internal Business Data, Personally Identifiable Information, Protected Health Information (with BAA)
documentation_tier: Tier 3: Third-party validation with comprehensive public and private documentation
assessment_notes: High confidence assessment based on comprehensive Microsoft documentation, third-party certifications, and established enterprise track record. Microsoft's extensive compliance program and transparent security practices provide strong evidence for scoring decisions.

recommended_restrictions: Disable web search if not required

recommendations.title: Configure Enterprise Data Protection
recommendations.description: Ensure Microsoft 365 Copilot Enterprise is properly configured with Enterprise Data Protection (EDP) enabled to maintain contractual protections and data isolation.

recommendations.title: Implement Data Loss Prevention
recommendations.description: Deploy Microsoft Purview DLP policies to monitor and control sensitive data interactions with Copilot, particularly for PHI and financial data.

recommendations.title: Review Web Search Settings
recommendations.description: Evaluate whether web search functionality is necessary for your use case, as it operates under different data handling practices than core Copilot features.

recommendations.title: Enable Comprehensive Auditing
recommendations.description: Configure Microsoft 365 audit logging to track all Copilot interactions and maintain compliance with organizational policies.

detailed_assessment.compliance_summary: Microsoft Copilot Enterprise maintains comprehensive compliance with major regulatory frameworks including HIPAA (with BAA), GDPR, SOC 2 Type II, and ISO 27001. Strong enterprise-grade security controls and contractual protections.
detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: Microsoft Copilot Enterprise demonstrates exceptional security posture with enterprise-grade data protection, comprehensive compliance certifications, and contractual guarantees against training use. The tool scored 18/100 (LOW RISK) making it suitable for general enterprise use including sensitive data processing. Recommended for approval with standard enterprise monitoring and proper configuration of Enterprise Data Protection features.

geographic_control.justification: Microsoft provides data residency commitments through Product Terms and supports EU Data Boundary for GDPR compliance. Data location is contractually controlled and configurable for enterprise customers, placing it in known secure regions with proper contractual protections.

encryption_standards.justification: Enterprise-grade encryption with AES-256 encryption at rest and in transit, documented encryption specifications, and rigorous physical security controls. Microsoft provides comprehensive encryption documentation and maintains industry-standard encryption practices.

data_retention.justification: Customer-controlled retention through Microsoft 365 retention policies. Organizations can configure retention periods according to their needs, with immediate deletion capabilities and clear retention policy inheritance from underlying Microsoft 365 services.

model_training.justification: Microsoft provides contractual guarantee that customer data, prompts, and responses are not used to train foundation models. This is explicitly stated in the Data Protection Addendum and Product Terms, with enterprise data protection ensuring organizational data remains separate from training datasets.

data_sharing.justification: No third-party sharing of enterprise data. Microsoft operates as data processor under DPA with strict data isolation between tenants. Customer data remains within Microsoft's ecosystem with no external sharing except as explicitly instructed by customer.

admin_management.justification: Full enterprise controls through Microsoft 365 Admin Center with centralized admin dashboard, comprehensive user provisioning/deprovisioning, role-based permissions, group management, and domain verification. Advanced identity management through Microsoft Entra ID integration.

audit_capabilities.justification: Comprehensive auditing through Microsoft 365 audit logs with real-time activity tracking, exportable reports, user action logging, and compliance reporting features. Full integration with Microsoft Purview for advanced audit capabilities.

integration.justification: Full enterprise integration with SAML/OIDC SSO, SCIM provisioning, Active Directory integration, and extensive API access. Native integration with Microsoft 365 ecosystem provides seamless enterprise identity management.

regulatory_violations.justification: Fully compliant with comprehensive certifications including SOC 2 Type II, ISO 27001/27017/27018, HIPAA BAA available, GDPR DPA compliance, and ongoing compliance programs. Microsoft maintains industry-leading compliance posture with regular third-party audits and certifications.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Full transparency with published data flow diagrams, clear data processing locations, detailed retention schedules, and comprehensive documentation of data handling practices. Microsoft provides extensive documentation on data processing activities and third-party relationships.

documentation_and_support.justification: Good documentation with clear privacy policies, security whitepapers, and comprehensive Microsoft Learn documentation. Regular transparency reports and responsive enterprise support, though some enterprise-specific documentation requires customer portal access.

use_case_multiplier_applied.use_case: Enterprise productivity enhancement with potential PHI/PII processing
use_case_multiplier_applied.data_classification: Internal Business Data, PII, PHI (with BAA)
